file_content.text: Security protocols have been disabled. Ecklin came through.
Almost. I ran when I heard the fighting. Let me finish this....
The Hutt in charge on Makeb is named Toborro. If Project Failsafe exists, there should be some reference to it in his communication logs.
I assume you've met Toborro. What's your take on him?
Tell me about him.
He isn't your typical Hutt. Quick profits matter less to him than long-term gains.
The Hutts are bound to be sending more reinforcements. We haven't got much time.
Don't take too long.
Back off! I don't want you "accidentally" erasing evidence, Ecklin.
Step away from the console!
Makeb doesn't belong to you and Shalim. I want to see this evidence myself.
Here... a holo from someone named Veedrig has a "Project Failsafe" tag. Let's hear what it says.
Greetings, oh great and glorious Toborro. I'm happy to report that Project Failsafe is both on schedule and under budget. Your grand ark is approaching completion.
[Listen to the holo]
Ever met this Veedrig before? He sounds like a used-speeder salesman.
Do you know that Devaronian?
I've heard the name once, but this is the first I've seen of him. Hideous fellow.
This isn't good news.
As these schematics illustrate, the ark's ingenious outer layer will completely shield the vessel and its precious contents from Makeb's atmospheric unpleasantness.
The cargo hold will store your entire isotope-5 stockpile while your chosen few companions travel in luxurious comfort on the ark's upper decks.
The Hutts don't have a way to save Makeb from breaking apart. They're just planning to leave the planet before that happens. You're on your own.
I understand what's happening.
They'll abandon us? Leave everyone to die? That's... that's monstrous!
I don't care about Toborro's private luxury barge. I need to know how the Hutts plan to keep Makeb from ripping apart.
Skip to the failsafe part.
Look at the size of that vessel. It is the Hutt failsafe! They'll fly away in their ark and leave Makeb's people to die!
Toborro's building a starship to evacuate the Hutts and transport this "isotope-5" offworld. Whatever that stuff is, it's worth Makeb's destruction.
Ever heard of isotope-5?
We've never mined anything called isotope-5. It must be something the Hutts discovered.
Mighty Toborro, may I suggest replacing the standard passenger cabins with deluxe suites more suited to a Hutt of your stature? I can easily add them before the ark's completion.
This holo is recent--Veedrig is still building the ark. That means there's time to steal it for ourselves and evacuate the planet.
That ark could save lives.
Listening to that scum blather is making me sick. Is there anything useful in the archives?
Shut this idiot off.
Wait, this is important. It sounds like they're still building the vessel somewhere on Makeb.
If we seize the ark, we could use it to evacuate the entire planet!
Someone needs to make that Hutt suffer. I nominate me.
Toborro must be killed.
Toborro's filth--no one's arguing that, especially not me right now--but killing him doesn't solve the real problem.
Makeb will be destroyed, and millions will die. But if we steal the ark, we could use it to evacuate the entire planet!
Based on the schematics, we'll have room for the whole population if we convert the cargo hold to carry passengers.
Good plan.
I thought there were millions of people on Makeb. Will they all fit inside that ship?
That's a lot of people.
You saw the schematics. If we convert the cargo hold for passengers, the ark should have enough room for everyone.
Shalim lied to get the Republic into this mess. What makes you think I'll do anything to save your people?
I don't care about Makeb.
I don't believe you'd let millions of innocents die. Even if you would, consider the Hutts.
This isotope-5--whatever it is--must factor into the Cartel's future plans. Stealing their vessel will stop them from transporting it offworld.
There are only so many places the Hutts could hide such a massive project. We have to find it.
Maybe there's another holo from Veedrig saying where he set up his construction site?
Search the archives.
Nothing that obvious. But if I dig deep enough, I'm sure I'll find something.
Evacuating this planet will require someone with resources and contacts. Shalim Avesta has both.
We should tell Shalim.
Maybe it's time to interrogate Veedrig's employer. Where do we find that slimy Hutt?
Let's ask Toborro personally.
Toborro would never trust a native like me with his location. Besides, we need to get our hands on the ark first.
I'll scour these archives and transmit everything I find to Shalim. Given the circumstances, I feel rather unsafe remaining here.
There's a shuttle pad nearby. If you remove the guards and unlock the shuttles, we could all fly away safely.
